page.title: 10The Village Church
page.content: The village church is very important to Chelsfield although it has been cut off from the old village by the By-Pass.It was built in Norman times andhas old oak beams to hold up the roof.Class 2 went to visit the church and Mrs.Blatcher showed us around. Mrs.Blatcher showed us where there used to be old Box Pews that used to have a stove in them to keep people warm in winter.The side chapel is where they hold services when there are not many people there. In St.Martains there are many old records written on vellum,these are the old registers.The church has a tower,it quite new because it had to be mended when some bits fell off.The roof is made of slate tiles and the walls are made out of a Kentish flint.
